div.head: A preface into the Sermon.
div.p: I Am comen hether this daye (Christen audyence) to preche at the buriall of this honoralbe Lady, my good Lady and Maistres. That that shalbe preached heare at this time, shal be to her nothing profitable: for lernynge tyme, wyth her is past, but this sermon may be vnto you al, that shalbe the hearers of thesame, if ye imprinte it wel in your mynd, and bere it wel away profitable. It may be (I sai) profitable to you al, of whatsoeuer state, condiciō or degree, ye be of.

¶ I haue chosen he parable, that our Sauiour Christe speketh of in the xvj. chapiter of sainte Luke, to treate of this day: out of the which parable, euery man mai learne, that marketh it wel, bothe how he dothe and also how he shoulde liue. And howe that if he lyue heare well, he shall euer after lyue well in ioye and pleasure. The contrary, if that he lyue not heare
well, he shall no lyue hereafter, that is, he shall be damned and suffer perpetuall payne in hell. That we all may heare the doctrine of this parable preched so, that it may be to the aduauncement of goddes glory and to the profite and vtilitie of his people, I shall desire you for to pray. &c.
